intro: Cupania fuscidula, commonly known as the redstem sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and small, pale green leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Cupania fuscidula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
